comments.author: Brusild
comments.body: I dont think people care that much, honestly. Football is football, fans do everything to get in the head of the players. You will be fine, there is like 1% chance you will meet a random 15 year old who might act rude, but as long as you don't provoke someone, you will be totally fine! Enjoy your holidays

comments.author: Prestigious-Mall375
comments.body: Dont worry pal. We're friendly towards foreigners/tourists. Even serbian people dont have to worry when they visit Albania.

comments.author: caesarj12
comments.body: No one will care where you are from as long as you behave. Tourists are treated well wherever they come from. Welcome and have a good time!

comments.body: Nobody cares that you're romanian, frate.

comments.body: Man go ahead and be worry free visiting Tirana. Nothing is gonna happen even if you shout in the streets Im Romanian!. Enjoy your stay

comments.author: flowgert
comments.body:
Generally we don't have a strong opinion about Romani as, neither positive nor negative.

The ones who have lived abroad generally have a slightly negative opinion about Romanians, the others just don't care where you're from. But... If I were you I wouldn't flaunt your nationality in vain, taking in consideration the last events. I mean, just to be sure you don't encounter a hot-head.

For the rest, you'll be more than okay and you'll enjoy yourself.

comments.author: Skinderjak
comments.body: Albanian here. Welcome man (or woman), youâ€™ll have fun in Tirana. People here are friendly and accommodating to guests from near and far. You may bump into some occasional asshole but youâ€™ll have overall a positive experience. Again, welcome!

comments.author: SensitiveMorning5484
comments.body:
To tell you the truth,we Albanians are patriots only when the national team plays.
So come and have a good time here

comments.author: ofive1
comments.body: At my company, works a romanian guy for 4 years already and he is feeling more albanian than romanian now. This means he feels at home here, and you don't have to worry about the nationalist incidents.

comments.author: Same-Platform-9793
comments.body: Fun fact - Bukurest, is translated into the Beatiful City in Albanian. There is lot of Dacian heritage in Kosovo as well, and mostly the people who are in origin Dacian have their surname Daci. It is believed that before around a millennia albanian and romanian language was closely related.
